alert.note: Alert for Rio Arriba (New Mexico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albuquerque (Northern and Central New Mexico)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued May 07 at 8:45AM MDT until further notice by NWS Albuquerque
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in New Mexico... Rio Chama Near Chamita affecting Rio Arriba County. Rio Ojo Caliente Below La Madera affecting Rio Arriba County. Los Pinos River at Ortiz affecting Rio Arriba County. .Warm temperatures will continue to melt high mountain snowpack and increase river flows. ...FLOOD WARNING FOR SNOWMELT REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL FURTHER NOTICE... * WHAT...Minor flooding is possible. * WHERE...Rio Ojo Caliente below La Madera. * WHEN...Until further notice. * IMPACTS...At 7.0 feet, farm and pasture land is being inundated, and irrigation channels and gates may be severely damaged if high flows persist. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 8:00 AM MDT Sunday the stage was 6.3 feet. - Forecast...The river will oscillate below flood stage with a maximum value of 6.8 feet tomorrow morning. - Flood stage is 7.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 6.5 feet on 05/17/1993. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood && Fld Observed Forecasts (6 am MDT) Location Stg Stg Day/Time Mon Tue Wed Rio Ojo Caliente La Madera 7.0 6.3 Sun 8 am MDT 6.8 6.8 6.8 &&
info.instruction: Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/abq. The next statement will be issued this evening around 1000 PM MDT.
